What we see in France -- and saw in New Orleans -- is only a foretaste of the non-White violence coming to America.
 
 The riots in France spread to other parts of Europe. The Arabs and sub-Saharan Africans who are displaying their cultural and genetic proclivities for upheaval and chaos have now escalated the conflict with cries of Jihad against the West. French police have discovered a bomb-making factory in Paris. Some of the rioters are chanting "it's Baghdad here." That is ominous news, even if the riots subside.
 
 Cast your eyes inward now, to the United States. Mexican invaders are now telling us that much the same thing can -- and probably will -- happen here. Insurrection is on their minds. The leading Mestizo advocacy groups, La Voz de Aztlan and MEChA, have vowed in no uncertain terms to 'reclaim' the southwest United States through either high birthrates, violence, or both.
 
 Continued:
 
 http://www.nationalvanguard.org/story.php?id=6890
 
 Or listen:

post_info.post_title: What do Paris and New Orleans Have in Common?

What do Paris and New Orleans have in common ? They both have French names.

What do Paris and New Orleans have in common ? They both have French names.

 
 In addition, they are both well known for their cuisine.

What do Paris and New Orleans Have in Common?
 
 Ooooh, wait, I know! Both cities are were built on large rivers?

What do Paris and New Orleans have in common?
 
 Both have corrupt and incompetent city officials?
Why are mexicans saying that is Baghdad in New Orleans? Though I suppose if they have Mechs you can't really argue.

Both cities have really great food. 
 
 Neither city welcomes white supremists.
Both cities were built by the French......therefore they are unusual cities, colorful, full of flavor, haute cuisine and definitely no place for White racists.

Why not?
 
 There's quite a lot of racism in France, why does French building make it any more unsuitable than anywhere else?
Is there a reason for feeding this troll?
We know he won't reply - this is all just for our consideration, raising awareness of the plight of our race.
It looks like he just dropped in to spread his propaganda...not interested in debate....maybe cannot think for himself ?

What do Paris and New Orleans Have in Common?
 
 
 If I lived in either city, I would recommend siegfriedson and his kind be the first ones targeted in the uprising.

If I lived in either city, I would recommend siegfriedson and his kind be the first ones targeted in the uprising.

 And now we enter the circular reasoning of the white supremist, far as he is concerned its this which justifies his beleifs, you dirty black devil, you Snakespit. Of course you could point out that if wasn't a whitesupremist he wouldn't be have this problem, but I suppose it explains who these sort of things tend to attract people to the extreme.
 If you are just a little bit racist, the response to more extreme racists seems to threaten you and make you consider that what they are saying might be right.

I'd like to counter what some of you in this thread have suggested, and that is that New Orleans is not a racist town.
 
 I wholeheartedly disagree. If you've ever gotten to know the average white person in New Orleans you will learn very quickly that they are quite racist.
 
 But it's racism that's not so much concerned with lynching or segregation, but more along the lines of complaining about blacks, whom most whites in New Orleans (actually the outlying areas) would call niggers, and making them the source for all social ills. 
 
 But now that I think of it, most white people in New Orleans would very much welcome the rebirth of segregation.
 
 And one of you said that Paris was a French name. I guess it is now, but originally it was Greek, no? I think Paris is named after the guy who killed Achilles.

And one of you said that Paris was a French name. I guess it is now, but originally it was Greek, no? I think Paris is named after the guy who killed Achilles.

 
 Paris (France) got its name from the Parisi tribe of Celtic Gauls who were living on the banks of the Seine in the time of Julius Caesar. (They are mentioned in Caesar's "Gallic Wars").
 
 Some of these continental Parisi emigated to England and settled on lands just north of where I'm living right now. 
 
 I don't know how Paris the Trojan, who abducted Helen, got his name. No doubt a Greek scholar on this forum probably does.
Might the Roman 'Parisi' have come from the Greek, and they themselves called them something very different - like Germans/Deutsch?

Might the Roman 'Parisi' have come from the Greek, and they themselves called them something very different - like Germans/Deutsch?

 I suppose it's possible the name "Parisi" might have come from the Greek language; but I suspect the word was recorded in Latin from whatever sounds the Roman soldiers thought they heard when it was spoken by the ancient Gauls. 
 
 Here's an example of what I'm suggesting. The word "bakhshish" is the Persian for a gift, a present of cash, or a tip. In British military slang, the word has become "buckshee" - meaning a something for nothing, a "freebie". There are many loan words like this which have become mangled in English and I expect the same happened in Latin.

And now we enter the circular reasoning of the white supremist, far as he is concerned its this which justifies his beleifs, you dirty black devil, you Snakespit. Of course you could point out that if wasn't a whitesupremist he wouldn't be have this problem, but I suppose it explains who these sort of things tend to attract people to the extreme.
 If you are just a little bit racist, the response to more extreme racists seems to threaten you and make you consider that what they are saying might be right.

 Could you explain this a little more clearly? I think I got what you were saying, but I want to make sure before I make an XXX out of myself.

I suppose it's possible the name "Parisi" might have come from the Greek language; but I suspect the word was recorded in Latin from whatever sounds the Roman soldiers thought they heard when it was spoken by the ancient Gauls. 
 
 Here's an example of what I'm suggesting. The word "bakhshish" is the Persian for a gift, a present of cash, or a tip. In British military slang, the word has become "buckshee" - meaning a something for nothing, a "freebie". There are many loan words like this which have become mangled in English and I expect the same happened in Latin.

 
 the 'isi' ending of 'parisi' seems distinctly latin to me, however it's not one of the suffixes I remember (us, i, o, um, o, imorum, is, as, is, o, are, ave, atum, and a handful of others I can remember given enough time and caffine- and yes, multiple 'o' endings. this is the kind of thing that killed latin and will kill english).
